thread.title: Flybe commercial boss to leave for Malaysia Airlines
thread.title_full: Flybe commercial boss to leave for Malaysia Airlines

title: Flybe commercial boss to leave for Malaysia Airlines
text:
Flybe commercial boss to leave for Malaysia Airlines 21 July 2015 Save 
Paul Simmons, the chief commercial officer of Flybe is quitting the carrier for a job at Malaysia Airlines. 
Simmons will leave at the start of 2016 and his role at Flybe will be split in two following his departure. 
Two appointments will be made: one as head of network planning and development, the other as head of the remaining commercial teams, which include sales & marketing and customer care. 
Saad Hammad, Flybe’s chief executive said: “Paul joined Flybe in 2013 and has had a strong impact in improving our customer proposition and refreshing our brand presentation. 
“He has been offered a great role at Malaysian Airlines and will be with us for up to six months to ensure a smooth transition of his responsibilities. “ 
Simmons joined Flybe from easyJet, where he was director of the UK market.
